temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 加粗几个字母之后，英语阅读速度原地起飞，真的这么神奇吗？ in the user temberature at 2022-06-02T07:15:27
item.description:
in reference to:

从这个角度来讲，仿生阅读也未必适用于所有文章。沈阳师范大学曾做过一项文本标注对中文阅读眼动的研究。研究显示，虽然添加高亮会指引和帮助参与者们更好地记忆重点内容、忽略干扰内容，但如果含有错误标识或标识过多，那与无标识的阅读效率几乎是一样的。同时，如果阅读的文本是比较简单的内容，那标示也未必可以提高正确率。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 加粗几个字母之后，英语阅读速度原地起飞，真的这么神奇吗？ in the user temberature at 2022-06-02T07:16:51
item.description:
in reference to:

加粗分词后的第一个字确实有助于帮助断句、加快阅读。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T04:55:39
item.description:
in reference to:

说某个东西「不是现在读」，那就几个月，之后是几个月之后再呈现…… 电子邮件收件箱、任务队列、个人通信等 我这些想象的核心，是每日都要练习的一种习惯，类似冥想：打开软件，完成软件呈上的微任务。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T05:05:35
item.description:
in reference to:

记忆：重复回忆问题；时间间隔随着回答成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 过程的流畅性：重复完成简短练习，有许多变体；时间间隔随着成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 卡片写作：重复问题、模糊的想法、主干想法，从中积累思考，时间跨度为几个月；将卡片标记为「有成果」或「无成果」，以扩大/缩小时间间隔 习惯养成：重复简短的反思卡片，可能根据顺序改变，应用于你的日常经验；间隔默认扩大，但可以放缓 阅读队列：一系列 PDF，标签页，书本，总在变换：如果一段时间内忽略某些内容，它就会暂离一周，之后是一个月；比如说「我现在读够什么了」，这东西就会几天之内再次呈现；说某个东西「不是现在读」，那就几个月，之后是几个月之后再呈现…… 电子邮件收件箱、任务队列、个人通信等

item.description:

some of the reasons have nothing to do with choosing the “best learning tool,” but with regards to how my workflow and my life have changed.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:35:57
item.description:
in reference to:

But here’s the catch: the connection doesn’t happen automatically. You still have to intentionally and consciously think about the big picture to improve your understanding.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:44:26
item.description:
in reference to:

From now on, my focus on “how to learn” would be shifted from “when should I review this” to “what should I do when I indeed review this?” It’ll be about thinking frameworks and mental models; it’s about “what and how to think” instead of “when to think.”

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/vim - Has anyone ever felt like the cognitive load of using motions balances out any benefits? in the user temberature at 2022-08-13T02:34:35
item.description:
in reference to:

You are still using your head. At some point most of the things that are vim related won't be processed by your brain but by your muscle memory.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/vim - Has anyone ever felt like the cognitive load of using motions balances out any benefits? in the user temberature at 2022-08-13T02:44:45
item.description:
in reference to:

Learning to use vim really is like learning a language. You're still "translating" in your head instead of just "speaking" naturally. Just keep practicing and it will become second nature with time.

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated ripgrep/GUIDE.md at master · BurntSushi/ripgrep in the user temberature at 2022-08-25T11:57:32
item.description:
in reference to:

Symbolic links aren't followed.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated ripgrep/GUIDE.md at master · BurntSushi/ripgrep in the user temberature at 2022-08-25T11:59:49
item.description:
in reference to:

Instead of writing out the glob every time, you can use ripgrep's support for file types:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated ripgrep/GUIDE.md at master · BurntSushi/ripgrep in the user temberature at 2022-08-25T12:01:10
item.description:
in reference to:

But you can define your own types as well.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated ripgrep/GUIDE.md at master · BurntSushi/ripgrep in the user temberature at 2022-08-25T12:02:55
item.description:
in reference to:

Alternatively, you can combine the --only-matching (or -o for short) with the --replace flag to achieve the same result:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated ripgrep/GUIDE.md at master · BurntSushi/ripgrep in the user temberature at 2022-08-25T12:05:43
item.description:
in reference to:

ripgrep will never modify your files. The --replace flag only controls ripgrep's output. (And there is no flag to let you do a replacement in a file.)

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated ripgrep/GUIDE.md at master · BurntSushi/ripgrep in the user temberature at 2022-08-25T12:20:33
item.description:
in reference to:

ripgrep passes the file path as the first and only argument to the command and also sends the contents of the file to stdin.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated ripgrep/GUIDE.md at master · BurntSushi/ripgrep in the user temberature at 2022-08-25T12:22:54
item.description:
in reference to:

If you wind up needing to search a lot of PDFs, then ripgrep's parallelism can make the speed difference even greater.

item.description:
in reference to:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated retrieve_pdf_metadata [Zotero Documentation] in the user temberature at 2022-09-04T17:33:54
item.description:
in reference to:

To use this feature, simply drag your existing PDFs into your Zotero library or use the “Store Copy of File” or “Link to File” options from the add new item menu (green plus sign). By default, Zotero will automatically retrieve metadata for each PDF, create an appropriate parent item, and rename the associated file based on the metadata. (You can disable these automatic functions in the General pane of Zotero preferences.)

item.description:
in reference to:

石墨烯地暖目前最大的问题在「涂层」，如果不去做好「封装」，长时间会氧化、粉化及脱落，不可能做到耐用 20 万小时。加上采用丝印工艺，两端涂布不均匀，容易产生「电阻差」，功率不到几年就衰退了，结果就是更耗电而你不自知！

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated OpenAI API in the user temberature at 2022-12-13T16:00:10
item.description:
in reference to:

There are two ways to limit the likelihood of the API making up an answer.Provide a ground truth for the API. If you provide the API with a body of text to answer questions about (like a Wikipedia entry) it will be less likely to confabulate a response.Use a low probability and show the API how to say "I don't know". If the API understands that in cases where it's less certain about a response that saying "I don't know" or some variation is appropriate, it will be less inclined to make up answers.
